gcci.text: At $3.15/hour for H100 compute, NVIDIA's pricing power remains intact despite geopolitical tensions, but hyperscalers are accelerating custom silicon development to reduce dependency and capex exposure.

gtpi.text: Our $1.25/1M token pricing forces API providers into a margin compression spiral, while open-source alternatives at similar price points are eroding enterprise lock-in and reshaping model selection criteria.

gagl.text: The 120 TWh annual load from AI infrastructure represents a 15-20% grid capacity shock in major markets, necessitating immediate nuclear baseload commitments to prevent rolling brownouts during peak training cycles.

aipi.text: The confluence of $3.15/hr compute costs, token price deflation to $1.25/1M, and 120 TWh energy consumption reveals unsustainable unit economics that portend a market correction within 18-24 months.
